_description: On the Evils of the Age — seven 7-line stanzas (ababbcc) with refrain

BodEngPoetb4.First Lines:
[R]eligious pepille leuyn in holynesseermabli with owte
                    transmutacoun…
BodEngPoetb4.Last Lines:
…Ner the wisdomes all we were in þe mireAnd perfit
                    stablenesse of suche as were a tire
BodEngPoetb4.Editions:
Lobel,  E. 
             “Notes and News.” 
             Bodleian Quarterly Record
         3 (1920-22): 219-24: 220 (first stanza only).
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The World Upside Down: A Middle English Amphibole.” 
             Anglia
         72 (1954): 385-9: 386-7.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 150-2.
